questions.question_text: Satsang Diksha Shlok 50 says: Shuddhih sarvavidhā pālyā bāhyā chā'bhyantarā sadā | Shuddhi-priyah prasīdech-cha shuddhi-mati jane ________ ||
questions.explanation: The shloka emphasizes the importance of purity, both internal and external, and states that Shri Hari is pleased with those who maintain shuddhi.

questions.question_text: According to Vachanamrut Je.5, what is considered the most important thing?
questions.explanation: Vachanamrut Je.5 states that worshipping Bhagwan is the most important thing.

questions.question_text: According to Satsang Diksha Shlok 55, strīoe bhālne vishe kevaļ _________ karavo. Tilak na karavu.
questions.explanation: The shloka specifies that women should only apply a kumkum chandlo on their forehead, and not a tilak.

questions.question_text: Which Vachanamrut says 'je brahmarūp thayo tene ja Purushottamnī bhaktino adhikār chhe'?
questions.explanation: Vachanamrut Loya 7 states that only one who has become brahmarup has the right to bhakti of Purushottam.

questions.question_text: Satsang Diksha Shlok 57 states: Aksharam-aham ityevam bhaktyā prasanna chetasā, Purushottama _________ mantram etam vadech-chhuchim
questions.explanation: This shloka encourages the devotee to chant the mantra 'Aksharam aham Purushottama-dāsosmi' with devotion and a joyful heart.

questions.question_text: According to Vachanamrut Gadhadha I-68, where does Maharaj reside?
options: In the asht prakārnī pratimā tathā sant
questions.correct_answer: In the asht prakārnī pratimā tathā sant
questions.explanation: Vachanamrut Gadhadha I-68, states that Maharaj resides in the asht prakārnī pratimā tathā sant.

questions.question_text: Which Purushottam Prakash quote states, 'Sant hu ne hu te vaļi sant re, Em Shrimukhe kahe Bhagwant re;'?
questions.explanation: This quote is from Purushottam Prakash 41/9.

questions.question_text: Satsang Diksha Shlok 61 states: Madhye tu sthāpayet tatra hyakshara-Purushottamau | Swāminam hi _________ Mahārājam cha tat param.
questions.explanation: This shloka instructs to place the murti of Akshar (Gunatitanand Swami) and Purushottam Maharaj in the center.

questions.question_text: According to Vachanamrut Gadhadha Madhya 21, what understanding removes all doubts from the path to liberation?
options: Understanding the greatness of both past incarnations of God and present manifest form of God and His Bhakta.
questions.correct_answer: Understanding the greatness of both past incarnations of God and present manifest form of God and His Bhakta.
questions.explanation: Understanding the greatness of both past incarnations of God and present manifest form of God and His Bhakta removes all doubts from the path to liberation.

questions.question_text: Swa.Vato.1/153 states: Swāminārāyan nāmnā mantra jevo bījo koī mantra āj _________ nathī.
questions.explanation: Swamini Vato 1/153 states that no other mantra is as powerful as the Swaminarayan mantra.

questions.question_text: According to Satsang Diksha Shlok 68, Whose remembrance should accompany pradakshina of the murtis?
questions.explanation: The shloka specifies that Akshar-Purushottam Maharaj should be remembered during the pradakshina.

questions.question_text: Satsang Diksha Shlok 69 states: Sāşhţāngā dandavat kāryāh praņāmāh purushais-tataha | Nārībhis-tūpavishyaiva _________ dāsa-bhāvataha.
questions.explanation: This shloka details that men should do sashtang dandvat pranam, while women should do panchanga pranam with a servant's heart.

questions.question_text: According to Vachanamrut Gadhadha Madhya 40, what is the result of showing hatred towards the bhaktas of God?
options: It is equivalent to hating God himself
questions.explanation: Vachanamrut Gadhadha Madhya 40 states that immense suffering comes to the jiva as a result of showing hatred towards the bhaktas of God.

questions.question_text: Satsang Diksha Shlok 72 states: Bhaktitah pūjayitvaivam Akshara-Purushottamam, Punar-āgama-mantreņa _________ nijātmani.
questions.explanation: This shloka describes that after performing puja with devotion, Akshar-Purushottam Maharaj should be invited to reside within one's self using the punaragaman mantra.

questions.question_text: According to Satsang Diksha Shlok 74, What kind of scriptures should be read daily for strengthening one's Satsang?
options: Scriptures with the updesho and ādesho of Shri Hari and the Guru
questions.correct_answer: Scriptures with the updesho and ādesho of Shri Hari and the Guru
questions.explanation: This shloka advises reading scriptures that contain the teachings and commands of Shri Hari and the Guru for strengthening one's Satsang.

questions.question_text: Satsang Diksha Shlok 76 states: Bhojyam naiva na peyam vā vinā _________ jalādikam.
questions.explanation: This shloka instructs one not to eat or drink anything, including water, before performing puja.

questions.question_text: According to Satsang Diksha Shlok 78, From what age should one's children begin having their own puja?
options: When they are old enough to understand
From the day of their birth
When they start going to school
questions.correct_answer: From the day of their birth
questions.explanation: The shloka emphasizes that children should begin having their own puja from the day of their birth.

questions.question_text: Satsang Diksha Shlok 64 contains the line 'Uttishtha Sahajānanda Shri-Hare Purushottama'. What is the next line of this shloka?
options: Swāminārāyaņam mantram japan kuryād gurum smaran
questions.explanation: The second line of Satsang Diksha Shlok 64 is 'Guņātītāʼkshara Brahmann-uttishtha krupayā guro'

questions.question_text: According to Satsang Diksha Shlok 77, What should one do if they are unable to perform puja due to old age or illness?
options: Have someone else perform the puja on their behalf
Perform a shorter version of the puja
Visualize the puja in their mind
questions.correct_answer: Have someone else perform the puja on their behalf
questions.explanation: The shloka advises that if one is unable to perform puja due to old age or illness, they should have someone else perform it on their behalf.
